Well here is the thing, trans people are a minority everywhere, but being a minority doesn't mean that you should have to be dismissed as a niche or fringe group. What is wrong with Dear White People? I assume you have seen at least several episodes to make up your mind, and determined whether or not it is good or not. So I am excited to hear your nuanced and thoughtful response as to why it is bad.

The image macro that was posted and spread around was fake, there was a completely different segments where they talked about how chromosones detirmened your sex, but in that segment they never talked about gender or anything related to gender identity, they strictly talked about biological sex.
So sure they talked about biological sexes, but they never expressed any sort of anti-trans sentiment, because that was never part of the conversation of that segment.

Well it is important to keep in mind that the vast majority of trans people and allies agrees that there is a difference between gender and sex, so this is not some anti-science push from the left, even though I am sure many people are running with that bogus story already.
This was most likely a misguided attempt of the copyright owners of the show to avoid controversy, it was never some sort of hysterical anti-intellectualism perpetrated by "SJW" to spare people's feeling, nor was there any real demand for the segment in question to be cut.

Yeah like I said in another thread, if people wanted to donate to Phil so he could buy enough skittles to fill a pool, then that would be perfectly okay. Because as long as the person is honest about what the patreon money go to, then that is all that matters, it is people's own money to spend however they want.
Like I don't want to donate to anyone on patreon, not even Phil, but if I wanted to know it would be simply based on who I believed deserved my money and what I believed I could gain from it. And with a larger audience Phil can provide his donators with something that smaller youtubers probably couldn't. So the only thing that matters is honesty, because all I think Phil is obligated to do is to be transparent about where the money is going.
